item.title: DHCP
item.description: DHCP The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) service on the HPE Cray EX system uses the Internet Systems Consortium (ISC) Kea tool. Kea provides more robust management capabilities for DHCP servers. For more information: https://www.isc.org/kea/. item.title: Troubleshoot DHCP Issues
item.description: Troubleshoot DHCP Issues There are several things to check for when troubleshooting issues with Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) servers. Verify the status of the cray-dhcp-kea pods and services (ncn-mw#) Check to see if the Kea DHCP services are running: kubectl get services -n services | grep kea Example output: cray-dhcp-kea-api ClusterIP 10.26.142.204 <none> 8000/TCP 5d23h cray-dhcp-kea-tcp-hmn LoadBalancer 10.24.79.120 10.94.100.222 67:32120/TCP 5d23h cray-dhcp-kea-tcp-nmn LoadBalancer 10.19.139.179 10.92.100.222 67:31652/TCP 5d23h cray-dhcp-kea-udp-hmn LoadBalancer 10.
